question: Arrange the following compounds in their decreasing order of reactivity towards Nucleophilic addition reaction.
<katex>$\text{CH}_3\text{COCH}_3, \text{CH}_3\text{COC}_2\text{H}_5, \text{CH}_3\text{CHO}$</katex>
explanation: Reactivity towards nucleophilic addition depends on the magnitude of positive charge on carbonyl carbon and steric hindrance.
Aldehydes are more reactive than ketones.
Smaller alkyl groups cause less steric hindrance.
Order: Acetaldehyde > Acetone > Methyl ethyl ketone.
